title: Tech News: Going Back to the Moon and Playing D&D in Space
itunes:title: Tech News: Going Back to the Moon and Playing D&D in Space
description:
NASA is going to try again with the Artemis I launch, part of the program to return humans to the Moon's surface. Microsoft faces potential resistance to its acquisition of Activision Blizzard among UK regulators. And Dungeons & Dragons sends a D20 to space. Kind of.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
content:encoded:
NASA is going to try again with the Artemis I launch, part of the program to return humans to the Moon's surface. Microsoft faces potential resistance to its acquisition of Activision Blizzard among UK regulators. And Dungeons & Dragons sends a D20 to space. Kind of.

itunes:keywords: NASA, Moon, Artemis, Artemis I, SLS, Space Launch System, Orion spacecraft, Constellation, Microsoft, Meta, Disney+, Disney, monetization, Activision Blizzard, video games, antitrust, anti-competitive, D&D, dice, space, Surrey, speeding, Waze, France, AI, image recognition, surveillance, digital art, automation, machine learning
